115231.content:
It was Friday afternoon and instead of being out with your friends or sitting up in your room blasting away at aliens on your favorite computer game like any other regular 14 year old guy; you instead were standing at the bottom of your garden, shovel in hand, digging up bunch of crappy weeds and sweating your ass off. "This blows," you thought to yourself as you gazed around the small garden, seeing that your job wasn't even half way done, wondering why the hell you had to do this anyway. It of course was at your mother's request, only minutes after returning from a rather uneventful day at school she had hijacked you at the door and sent you outside while you're little sister Becky sat and watched her cartoons and got out of doing anything as usual.

The garden had once been your mom's pride and joy, spending hours every morning tending to it and making sure everything looked nice and pretty (not that it bothered you much) and then would sit out in it with a book in hand, enjoying the fruits of her labor, at least until you and your sister got home. That however all changed when your dad left two years ago, running off abroad with some woman from his work, meaning your mom had to get a job to support you all, the garden having to take a back seat while she worked as a secretary for some business firm, having very little time for it and having to concentrate more on keeping the rest afloat. That’s of course where the weeds and you having to dig them all up came in, becoming tired of her once nice garden looking like a tangled mess and getting the only man now in the house to take care of it all; a job that you could rather do without.

"Matt, how you getting on?" you heard a voice from behind say as you stopped to wipe the sweat from your brow, turning round to see your mom peering out the back door, assessing your progress with her dark brown eyes.

"I dunno, okay I guess," you shrugged, still not particularly happy at your mom for making you do this (especially seeing how at your current rate it would take almost till dinner time to finish).

"Well be sure to get the ones in the corner next to the chrysanthemums, they're pretty bad back there."

"They're pretty bad everywhere," you replied with an angry sigh, dropping the spade to the floor, "Why do I even have to do this anyway? You haven't bothered with it for the last two years!"

"Because it needs done Matt, just look at the state of it," your mom said sternly, stepping out the door slightly, "And I just don't have the time, I've got work still to get finished, the dinner to make and be out by seven, it's about time you helped a little around the place."

"Well what about Becky? She doesn't do anything! Why doesn't she help?" you inquired, still annoyed that your little sister got off scot free.

"Becky's too young for this kind of job and you are the man around the house now, remember? Stop trying to pass your responsibilities onto others." Somehow this annoyed you even more; you'd never asked to be "man of the house", it was your dad's fault for ditching you all and as for your sister being too young, she was 10, that's plenty old enough to dig up weeds with a spade! Your mom treated her like she was made of china or something, always letting her get her own way and do what she liked, while you were the one who had to do all these little extra chores and act "responsible" all the time.

"Yeah well I don't want to be the man around the house," you grumbled, crossing your arms in protest. Your mom however, simply scowled at you in that very familiar motherly way, shaking her head slightly and said, "Don't strop Matthew, it's not very becoming. And make sure and get those weeds behind the chrysanthemums done. Dinner will be ready at 6." And with that she returned back into the house, leaving you alone with the weeds once again.

Letting out a long sigh, you picked the spade up and went back to work, thinking about how much you preferred the old mom, before dad had left, when she was much more relaxed and care free, not so moody and strict all the time. "Sooner I get these done, the sooner I can hit the XBox," you thought to yourself, heading to the corner your mom had made such a fuss about, glancing up momentarily to see your little sister staring at you from her bedroom window, her hands pressed up against the glass and her tongue sticking out her mouth. Turning your back on her, well aware that she was rubbing it in, you plunged the spade into the ground and suddenly heard a large clunking sound, obviously having just hit something that wasn't dirt. "What the heck?" you said inwardly, padding the ground again with the spade, hearing another clunk as it came into contact with something just below the surface. Curious to what it was, you dropped the spade and started digging with your fingers, assuming that it may be some old toy from years ago that had gotten lost in the garden, or perhaps something your dog Glenn had buried, you cleared the dirt away and pulled out a weird silver colored stone. "What the hell is this thing?" you said, gazing at the triangular shaped rock, it's surface amazingly smooth and some sort of symbols carved into its surface that you couldn't quite make out with all the muck covering it. Wiping off as much of the dirt as you could, wondering if perhaps it was some sort of ancient artifact left by native American’s or something (and becoming rather excited at the thought it might be worth a lot of money) you looked at the symbols which appeared to be little more than wavy white lines that made absolutely no sense to you and figured maybe you could check it out on the Internet later. Putting the stone into your pocket you then returned to work, happy with your discovering and glad that you had at least gotten something out of this tedious task.

About an hour later you had finally finished, the garden now looking like a mass weed grave as you'd strewn them all over the place, not being particularly tidy with your work, too eager to get finished to care. "Next time Becky is definitely doing this instead," you said to yourself, wiping your brow and throwing down the spade, before heading back into the house, kicking off your muddy shoes in the process.

11523221.content:
"Try to keep up kiddo!" a man called down as he continued to scale the cliff. A teenager, approximately sixteen years old, grumbled to himself as he followed the older man.
"I'm not a little kid anymore Kurt!" he shouted to the man.
"Maybe not, but you'll always be my baby bro," Kurt smiled, casing the boy to roll his eyes, sure, he liked his brother, in fact, his brother was epic, Kurt was always adventurous and restless, he often traveled to odd locations to explore them, it was great when Kurt invited him along, they always had loads of fun and end up discovering something awesome, it was almost a tradition for the two of them to go exploring ever year during the Christmas break. The biggest problem he had with Kurt was the tendency the man had with treating him like a little kid, he would always act super protective and talk to him degradingly, he absolutely hated it. Unfortunately they didn't come from the most stable home, their mother was bi-polar and as such suffered extreme mood swings, she was constantly on medication and anti-depressants but that caused her to be constantly tired and distant, she hated it and eventually stopped taking her medication, leading to her becoming mentally unstable. Their father tried his hardest to keep the family afloat by working two jobs and he managed to do it, that obviously lead to him not having any time for his sons. Kurt agreed to take care of his younger brother while his parents were busy, which would probably have led to the fatherly attitude towards his brother. Everything was stable until their father's lung cancer had returned, he managed to survive the first time but the second time he wasn't so lucky, his death led to their mother committing suicide, leaving an eighteen-year-old Kurt to take care of his ten-year-old brother. The brothers reached the top of the cliff and Kurt reached his hand out to brother, who declined it and hoisted himself up.

"I'm fine to do it by myself," the youngest informed.
"That's what you said about potty training too Rex," Kurt informed, slapping the boy playfully on his butt. "But I couldn't count the amount of accidents I had to clean up." Rex blushed slightly before pushing his brother out of the way he walked forward and discovered a large temple, it was made of stone, obviously, with a large arch entrance that was guarded by two statues, the statues were of a men, one was holding a spear with a shield that housed an odd symbol, resembling a clock, and the other gripped a sword, on the hilt appeared to be an eye-like symbol.
"Wow," was the only thing that could escape Rex's lips, he was so entranced by the temple, the vines slowly taking over the statues and the perfect marble flooring were breath-taking.
"Well, are you going to enter it?" Kurt asked, "or do you need help with that?" he smirked. Rex rolled his eyes and entered the temple, the entrance was long and dark, once the light from the outside was insufficient Rex and Kurt turned on their torches. The path branched off into two paths.
"We should take a path each," Rex suggested.
"I'm not sure if that's a good idea," Kurt replied.
"It's fine," Rex reassured, this isn't my first temple. Kurt hesitated for a moment before nodding, he walked down the left path, leaving Rex to explore the right one. The boy walked through the corridor, not finding anything particularly interesting, that was, of course, until he discovered a strange light emitting from another room. Curious, he entered and found a strange alter of some description, the light seemed to be coming from a stone slab in the centre of the room, Rex cautiously walked towards the slab, lying on it was a necklace, the necklace was a black cord with a dragon pendant attached. Rex picked it up and the glowing stopped.
11523221.title: Deep In The Ruins

115232212.content:
Rex pocketed the amulet before returning to his brother, they explored the rest of the temple, to which they discovered nothing of interest. They returned home with Rex bursting through the door, Kurt owned a two bedroom flat in the city, the furniture was super modern with a distinct yellow colour theme to it, which Rex really liked. Rex hastily entered his room and shit the door behind him, his room had a wooden floor with a blue single bed to the right side, there was an in-built wardrobe next to the door and beside the bed was a desk. Littering the walls were posters of shows Rex enjoyed. He pulled out the necklace and examined it, it was made of bronze presumably with ruby eyes, Rex placed it over his head as a bright light filled the room, the boy used his arm to shield his eyes from the blast of light, once the light had dimmed to a reasonable intensity Rex lowered his hand. Rex spotted a man standing before him and backed up, utterly shocked.
"Who are you?" he demanded. The man looked at him, he was hearing clothing similar to the statues at the temple.
"You have summoned me master," the man bowed.
"Master?" Rex asked, he had seen some crazy things but this was flat out weird.
"Yes, you are in possession of my amulet and as such I am at your command," the man informed.
"What are you?" Rex asked, finding it safe to assume the man wasn't human.
"I am Zaman, Genie of the Temple of Eternity and guardian of time and perception," Zaman explained.
"Really a genie?" Rex asked, "So like, grant three wishes type of genie?"
"I can change the age and perception of age," Zaman clarified, "as the holder of my amulet you can command anything, there are, unfortunately, limitations."
"I only get three wishes," Rex assumed, "yeah, I'm pretty familiar with genie magic."
"There is no limitation on the amount of wishes," Zaman informed, "my limitations is that you can not influence anyone in a way that would drastically impact the future."
"Wait? So I get unlimited wishes," Rex asked, Zaman nodded.
"As long as you are in possession of the amulet," Zaman confirmed, "I should warn you though, I am one of six guardians, each with different powers and owners, you hold immense power around your neck and some may go to extreme lengths to obtain that power."
"That tends to be the case with rare powers," Rex nodded.

Rex looked around the corner, his brother was lying on the lounge watching TV.
"So I can ask you to change the age or perspective of anyone?" Rex asked.
"As long as it won't impact the future," Zaman clarified.
"So, say if I ask you to make Kurt a ten year old?" Rex asked.
"Consider it done," Zaman clicked his fingers as Rex watched his brother shrink, he was now only ten years old and watching a cartoon on the TV.
"That's so cool!" Rex cheered, "are you able to change him back?" Rex asked. Zaman clicked his fingers again and Kurt returned to his usual self.
"That is only a fraction of my powers," Zaman informed. Rex smiled wickedly, if he wanted to this would be his chance to get back at his brother and be the big brother for a change, he could switch his age with Kurt's or simply make Kurt younger. Of course, he didn't have to get revenge on his brother he could have a little fun with it himself.
115232212.title: At Your Command Master

Amy Star was feeling old today, it was her 59 birthday and she felt old. Her husband died a few years ago in a car crash leaving her alone but rich from the insurance, also her sons had all moved out and on their own. This time around, she had something extra special to show them: a new youth potion that she had invented, and she had enough for everyone. Tonight was going to be fun.

After a few good drinks and some dating disaster stories, it came time to reveal her special secret. The potion vials were part of a cloth-covered centerpiece in the middle of the living room table. With one swift motion, Christine whipped off the covering to reveal the brightly colored liquids.

"Surprise! Do you girls remember how I told you about my potion-making? Well, I made a new batch of youth potion here that I wanted to share with you."

One of the girls picked up a vial and shook it in her hands incredulously.

"I dunno, Chris. I just ain't buyin' it. How do we know that this weird stuff does what you say it'll do? Maybe if you tried it first."

The room fell deathly silent. All eyes on her, Christine raised the first vial to her lips and threw back her head, draining it all. Already she could feel the potion working. Giggling, she lifted her shirt and watched as her light potbelly shrank back into her stomach, leaving her as young and slim as she had been in high school. Her feet also felt a bit smaller in her high heels. But will it speed up?

Ariana was now being cradled in the arms of a girl not much older than her. She looked to be about eighteen or nineteen, and from her clothes she figured that this was a McDonald's employee.

         "Well, where did you come from, little girl?" she cooed, giggling somewhat as if Ariana was just the cutest thing she'd ever seen. "Where are your clothes?"

         Ariana kicked her legs and tried to respond, but all that came was incoherent babble. The people around the restaurant were looking at this spectacle, and many were shaking their heads at the idea that someone would leave their baby like this.

         "Come on, sweetie," said the girl. "My name's Alice, and I'm going to take care of you until we can find out where you belong."

         Alice carried Ariana into her manager's office, a woman named Sabrina, who looked stunned to see one of her employees walking in with a naked infant. Before she could ask a question, Alice quickly explained that she found the baby in the play area with no clothes and no adult guardian.

         "Well, that's sad," said Sabrina as she took the baby from Alice. "Well, I guess we have no choice but to call child services."

         As Sabrina called child services, however, one of the parents in the play area felt bad about Ariana's predicament and gave loaned them some of their baby's diapers. Ariana then felt herself be carried to the bathroom, where Alice placed her on the changing table and placed in a pink disposable diaper.

         "That's better, isn't it?" she said, to which Ariana replied with a giggle. Internally, however, she was freaking out. What was she to do now? Her family would be expecting a teenager. If they didn't figure out something soon, she might end up in foster care.

         What happens now?

info.brief_description: Watch as the main character or someone else change their ages into whatever they want.
info.description:
Welcome to An Age Changing Experience. In this story, the main character or another person changes ages based on a variety of events. To start, select which gender is your main character then what age ranging from 0 (newborn) - 100 (Elderly). After that, pick what type of change occurs to the main character or the other person.

Here are the ground rules:

1. This story involves only age regression or progression, no animal changes or transgender.

2. Do not kill the main character or the other characters, unless you want the characters to be unbirthed and unconcieved.

3. No gay or lesbian related sex scenes.

4. Make sure that the sex scenes are appropriate, nothing too extreme.

Other then that, Have Fun!
